newsitem.title: USA: CBOT corn ends mixed amid delivery stopper, cold.
newsitem.headline: CBOT corn ends mixed amid delivery stopper, cold.

text.p: CBOT corn futures closed mixed with nearby months firm on strong stopping of deliveries on the expired December contract and on cold weather in the U.S., traders said.
"Cargill stopped all the corn this morning and that helped the bull spreads," a trader said.
There were 2.14 million bushels of corn posted Friday for delivery on the December and the Cargill Investor Services house account stopped all of it, according to the CBOT.
But volume was thin and trading was quiet with the market settling into a holiday trading atmosphere, traders said.
Some support came from bitter cold weather in much of the U.S. which was boosting livestock feed consumption and slow farmer selling also was mentioned as a supportive influence.
Nearby March was boosted by Refco Inc's purchase of six million bushels and LIT America bought five million bushels of March, traders said.
Smith Barney sold 8.5 million bushels of July and Barney also was a featured buyer of 1,500 December $2.80 puts at 31-1/2 to 32 cents, traders said.
Corn closed 3/4 cent per bushel higher to 1-1/2 lower, with March up 3/4 at $2.66-3/4.
Corn futures volume was estimated at 40,000 contracts, below the 41,272 contracts traded Thursday, according to the CBOT.
In addition to the Smith Barney moves in corn options, Term Commodities bought 1,000 March $3.00 calls at 7/8 cent and Refco Inc sold 500 March $2.70 puts at nine cents, traders said.
Corn options volume was estimated at 7,000 contracts, above the 6,822 traded Thursday.
